metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15910 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Artifex Ghostscript before 9.24, attackers able to supply crafted PostScript files could use a type confusion in the LockDistillerParams parameter to crash the interpreter or execute code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.9
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.9
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.9
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.9').
